body: I tried to navigate through the GlyphLayout code and its commit history to try to glean some kind of helpful info, and I came up empty. There's been several commits to GlyphLayout since 1.9.11, they all seem to require pretty substantial knowledge of GlyphLayout internals to understand, and any one or several of these commits could be the culprit(s). Help us, @NathanSweet , you're (probably) our only hope!
Oh boy, GlyphLayout fun! I can take a look as soon as I'm untangled from other things, likely Monday.

I've also tried trying to understand the changes but the fact that there's no PR for them with some description on the issue they try to solve, reproduction steps and some more detail that explains the new code it's really hard. @NathanSweet Thanks for looking into this when you have time. I have a modest suggestion to make. I understand you have a very deep knowledge of libGDX and you feel confident pushing changes directly to master withouth review but it would be great, for the rest of us and the health of the project itself, if you could make them through more formal PRs (even if you merge them immediately) for doumentation purposes and to allow other contributors to test or fix any possible issue, otherwise the knowledge gets lost. It may be even proof useful to you in the future to remember stuff that you changed in the past, GlyphLayout for example is a beast, no human mind can keep track of that complexity!

> it would be great, for the rest of us and the health of the project itself, if you could make them through more formal PRs (even if you merge them immediately) for doumentation purposes and to allow other contributors to test or fix any possible issue, otherwise the knowledge gets lost.

I would do that if it helped, but I don't see a difference between a commit message and a PR that is merged without review, except that the PR takes slightly more of my time. Such PRs would have the text from the [commit messages](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commits/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g2d/GlyphLayout.java). A PR does make sense when changes need review or to group multiple commits.

FWIW, when GlyphLayout was added it was [via a PR](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2955). Even with more elaborate commit messages or PRs, it's still going to take quite some effort to find, read, and make sense of them all, and after that GlyphLayout is still going to be pretty complex.

> GlyphLayout for example is a beast, no human mind can keep track of that complexity!

Nah, it would just take a bit of effort for others to work on it. It's all right there, in the code! Look at all those nice comments! ;)

It is certainly easy to break, as there are so many edge cases. To really improve the situation it would need a lot of tests and others would still need to want to put in the effort needed to help maintain it. That may not be worthwhile, given it's a reasonably mature class and pretty widely used.

The recent changes fixed things that needed fixing, so even if they broke something with scaled fonts, it's likely better to debug the scaled fonts problem directly rather than find the change responsible. I'll check it out today.
@obigu The link to the repro code doesn't work, the server never returns a response. Maybe you can post it here or somewhere more reliable, eg gist?
@NathanSweet Blast, can you try this https://pastebin.com/tMZu7gbu?
Yep that works, thanks. Fix incoming!

issue.title: [Scene2D] Scaled Font with markup wrapping issue on 1.10.0
issue.body:
#### Issue details
Hi all. 

This is a related issue of https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/6294

When I have markup enabled, sometimes labels are wrapped incorrectly.

Example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56004737/120535159-0a0e2f80-c3b9-11eb-8f1a-c308b3b4d256.png)

Note that I tried to increase the `epslon` added by the fix in the related issue above (I tried values up to `10f`), but the wrapping issue still happens.

(I changed the `epslon` using reflection.)

#### Reproduction steps/code

Please check the example code here:

[label-wrap-test.zip](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/6586718/label-wrap-test.zip)

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

I'm using libGDX 1.10.0.

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [X] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

Let me know if you need more information, thanks!
